page.title: 13BUILDING MATERIALS
page.content:
THE OLDEST BUILDINGS ARE BUILT OF {FLINT,}FACED INSIDE WITH PLASTERED OVER{WATTLE AND DAUB.}THE{MORTAR}IN WHICH THE FLINTS ARE SET CONSISTS OF SAND, WATER AND LIME. THE LIME WAS MINED IN SMALL LOCAL PITS. FLINT IS VERY EASY TO FIND IN THE{CHALK AREAS OF NORFOLK AND SUFFOLK. THE WHOLE FLINTS ONCE INSET, ARE EITHER LEFT {WHOLE OR KNAPPED}OFF FOR A FLAT OUTLINE. IN THE LATER BUILDINGS A MIXTURE OF{BRICK AND FLINT}IS USED. SOMETIMES IN THE NEW BUILDINGS BRICKS OR{BREEZE BLOCKS}ONLY ARE USED BEING JOINED WITH EITHER{FLEMISH OR ENGLISH BOND. COMMON FEATURES ARE BRICK CORNER BUTTRESSES ENDING OFF THE FLINT. ON THE FARMS ARE SEVERAL{PRE-FABRICATED SHELTERS
{G.TOONE {A.STEVENS}
